name: Maestro Labs Notetaker Enterprise
summary_and_recommendation: HIGH RISK tool that automatically captures and processes meeting audio, transcripts, and participant data. Major concerns include unclear AI training usage, indefinite data retention, limited enterprise controls, and automatic sensitive data collection. Recommend blocking for environments with confidential data or requiring comprehensive enterprise controls and explicit opt-out guarantees before any deployment.

recommended_restrictions: Require explicit user consent per meeting

recommendations.title: Implement explicit AI training opt-out
recommendations.description: Require contractual guarantee that meeting transcripts and audio are never used for AI model training, with clear documentation of data processing boundaries

recommendations.title: Establish data retention controls
recommendations.description: Negotiate specific retention periods (â‰¤90 days) with automatic deletion capabilities for meeting transcripts and recordings

recommendations.title: Deploy enterprise admin controls
recommendations.description: Implement centralized admin dashboard with user provisioning, meeting audit logs, and organizational-level meeting policies

detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: HIGH RISK tool that automatically captures and processes meeting audio, transcripts, and participant data. Major concerns include unclear AI training usage, indefinite data retention, limited enterprise controls, and automatic sensitive data collection. Recommend blocking for environments with confidential data or requiring comprehensive enterprise controls and explicit opt-out guarantees before any deployment.

geographic_control.justification: Data is stored in United States and European Union locations according to privacy policy. While US/EU are generally secure jurisdictions, there is no customer control over specific data residency. Policy states 'specific storage location depends on the service and infrastructure used, not the user's location' indicating limited geographic control for customers.

encryption_standards.justification: Privacy policy mentions 'security monitoring' and references to protecting data but does not provide specific encryption standards documentation. No mention of AES-256, customer-managed keys, or detailed encryption specifications. This represents basic encryption at best with limited technical details provided.

data_retention.justification: Privacy policy states 'We retain personal data only for as long as necessary to provide our services, comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements' with no specific time limits. For service data, it mentions 'retention periods vary based on the type of data and contractual agreements' and 'certain MailMaestro data... is retained only for a limited time, while other service-related data... may be stored for longer.' This represents indefinite/unclear retention without specific deletion timelines.

model_training.justification: Privacy policy states 'To perform our services, we share email content and user instructions with third-party AI models as part of Maestro Lab's functionality' but does not explicitly address whether meeting transcripts, audio recordings, or user data is used for AI model training. No clear opt-out mechanism is documented for training use, and no contractual guarantee against training use is provided. This represents default training use with difficult or unclear opt-out.

data_sharing.justification: Privacy policy indicates broad data sharing: 'We share personal data with trusted third-party service providers who assist in delivering our services. These providers support functionalities such as cloud storage, AI processing, transcription services, and security monitoring.' While contractually bound, this represents broad sharing with unclear complete disclosure of all third-party relationships.

admin_management.justification: Documentation does not provide evidence of centralized admin dashboard, user provisioning/deprovisioning capabilities, or role-based permissions for enterprise deployments. Privacy policy mentions 'For enterprise clients, retention settings may be customized as agreed upon' suggesting some enterprise features exist, but no specific admin management capabilities are documented. This represents limited administrative controls.

audit_capabilities.justification: No documentation of activity logs, exportable reports, user action tracking, or audit capabilities for administrators. Privacy policy mentions data subject rights and data processing but no evidence of organizational audit tools for meeting transcripts, user activities, or data access logging. This represents no audit capabilities for enterprise administrators.

integration.justification: Tool integrates with Microsoft Teams and provides SSO through Microsoft ecosystem. Privacy policy mentions enterprise client customization capabilities, suggesting some level of enterprise integration support. However, no specific documentation of SAML/OIDC SSO, SCIM provisioning, or API access for enterprise management is provided, though Microsoft Teams integration suggests basic enterprise compatibility.

regulatory_violations.justification: Privacy policy demonstrates GDPR compliance awareness with detailed data subject rights, data processing transparency, and European Data Protection Board guidance references. However, no published third-party certifications (SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA) are documented. Trust Center page was inaccessible, preventing verification of compliance certifications. This represents partial compliance with gaps in specialized requirements.

data_processing_transparency.justification: Privacy policy provides good transparency about data processing including specific details about what data is collected (audio recordings, transcripts, user identification), how it's used, and retention policies. Clear disclosure of third-party AI processing and data sharing arrangements. Some gaps remain in detailed data flow diagrams and complete third-party processor lists.

documentation_and_support.justification: No comprehensive security documentation available. Trust Center page (https://security.maestrolabs.com/) was inaccessible, preventing verification of security whitepapers, incident response procedures, or detailed security documentation. Privacy policy is present but represents minimal documentation without security-specific technical details. No evidence of transparency reports or comprehensive security documentation.
